labels: hold for later
title: Investigate record: https://ror.org/01br3aa17
body:
User feedback re: Biophysics Center of Armenian (https://ror.org/01br3aa17)     

> This "Biophysics" entity is not shown in the diagram of the current structure of the Armenian Academy of Sciences (the domain sci.am/)

We should investigate whether this organization is still active. If not, the record should be deprecated.
comments:
adambuttrick
05/23/2022, 16:39:16 | 05/23/2022, 16:43:18
comment_text: According to [this description](http://www.biophys.am/pages/index/About/), the organization has been inactive since 1996, when it was restructured into a new entity:

>"In 1996 the Biophysics Center of Armenian NAS was awarded the status of UNESCO Chair in Life Sciences by UNESCO Director General Mr. Federico Mayor and was reorganized into Life Sciences International Postgraduate Educational Center (LSIPEC). LSIPEC is specialized in Biophysics, Biotechnology, Environmental Health, Neuroscience, Biomedical Engineering."


It is likewise not listed on the [Armenian NAS page](https://www.sci.am/orgs.php?langid=2).

Since Life Sciences International Postgraduate Educational Center already exists in ROR (https://ror.org/02yqgb753), we should just deprecate this record.


---

body:
We have two records in ROR for the Open Geospatial Consortium:

1. https://ror.org/00fsdxs93 is a US location
2. https://ror.org/00nz0j151 is UK location

The website https://www.ogc.org/ lists the location as Massachusetts USA. 

Recommendation: We should merge the two records and redirect the UK record to the US one. The website in the US record needs to be updated from http://www.opengeospatial.org/ to https://www.ogc.org/

Description of change: The Polytechnic Institute of Porto (https://ror.org/04988re48) has eight schools. They exist since 1886, but by the Law nº70/88, from 3 of March of 1988 they were integrated in Polytechnic Institut of Porto (https://dre.pt/web/guest/pesquisa/-/search/287592/details/normal?q=decreto-lei+n%C2%BA70%2F88+de+3+de+mar%C3%A7o)

labels: level 2; new record; lion; hold for later; org-requested
title: Add Łukasiewicz Research Network – Institute of Organisation and Management in Industry
body:
Summary: Add a new organization to ROR
Name of organization: Łukasiewicz Research Network – Institute of Organisation and Management in Industry
Polish name: Sieć Badawcza Łukasiewicz – Instytut Organizacji i Zarządzania w Przemyśle "ORGMASZ"
Website: http://www.orgmasz.pl
Information about this request: As the research institute we are obliged to participate in a global scientific network, therefore naturally we hope to become a member of ROR community. We are a new institute (established in May 2020), member of Łukasiewicz Research Network. Till today we do not have any published scientific papers. Our scope of interest revolve around subsequent topics: technology assessment, technology foresight, health technology, inteligent mobility, digital transformation and sustainable development etc.
comments:
nlundvick
06/18/2021, 18:00:30 | 06/18/2021, 18:00:30
comment_text: This appears to be a type of consulting organization. Also, it is relatively new (2020) and is undergoing reorganization: "The Łukasiewicz Research Network –  Institute of Organisation and Management in Industry is undergoing reorganization and soon will be replaced by a new institute focused on technology assessment. The Institute for Technology Assessment will be operating as a part of the Łukasiewicz Research Network. We work with public institutions, private companies, as well as non-governmental organizations and provide them with expert knowledge about the effects of introducing new technologies." I found one example of affiliation use (DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.14874.36805). Recommend moving to Hold for later until reorganization is complete and there are more instance of affiliation use.

---
arthurpsmith
08/03/2021, 14:01:45 | 08/03/2021, 14:01:45
comment_text: I don't understand why this is claimed to be a "new institute" - yes it is new under the Lukasiewicz name, but under the name "ORGMASZ" which is also the website it uses it's been around since 1950.
Wikidata id: Q942790
ISNI: 0000 0001 1092 167X
Wikipedia page (Polish): https://pl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instytut_Organizacji_i_Zarz%C4%85dzania_w_Przemy%C5%9Ble_%E2%80%9EOrgmasz%E2%80%9D

Maybe what they are referring to with the "new" statement is Nick's comment regarding a reorganization and name change in progress?

Anyway, I'm fine with the "Hold" for now if it's in the middle of a major change, but I think it clearly should have a ROR id one way or another and soon! Let's revisit before the end of 2021?

---
adambuttrick
05/23/2022, 18:04:21 | 05/23/2022, 18:04:21
comment_text: Situation is unchanged. Continue to hold until they finish re-org.

---

labels: level 1; new record; lion; needs discussion
title: Add a new organization to ROR: Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization to be added | Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata

Organization website | https://openscholarlymetadata.org/

Briefly explain why you are requesting a ROR ID for this organization and how the ROR ID will be used. | Scholarly infrastructures such as CDL, Crossref and DataCite all have RORs. Inspired by PIDapalooza 2021, following these examples, and having just requested a ROR for OpenCitations, I request a ROR for OpenCitations' host institution The Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata.

Provide DOI(s) or links for research associated with this organization, such as published articles that include the organization's name as an affiliation. If DOIs or links are not available, describe the research-related activities of this organization. | https://doi.org/10.1162/qss_a_00023

Other relevant metadata about the organization (e.g., name variants in other languages, related records in ROR, links to external records such as Wikidata) | https://github.com/openscholarlymetadata, https://workshop-oc.github.io/
comments:
arthurpsmith
05/05/2021, 18:42:38 | 05/05/2021, 18:42:38
comment_text: While this has an independent URL, the example affiliation listings look like "Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata, Department of Classical Philology and Italian Studies, University of Bologna", which clearly suggests this is part of the University of Bologna. As does the "About" page on the website. I think this is not a top-level organization and so does not qualify for its own ROR id.

---
carlyrobinson
07/12/2021, 15:17:37 | 07/12/2021, 15:17:37
comment_text: May be associated with two separate organizations - OpenCitations (which we've already approved to add to ROR) and  University of Bologna within the Department of Classical Philology and Italian Studies. Used as an affiliation, but under this department at University of Bologna. Not sure if it should have separate ROR.

---
mariagould
07/15/2021, 17:56:41 | 07/15/2021, 17:57:08
comment_text: Some additional comments from the original request that may shed light on the need for a new ROR ID and the center's relationship to OpenCitations:

> The reason that we need two RORs, one for OpenCitations and one for the Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata is as follows:

> OpenCitations is distinct from and pre-existed the Research Centre, having grown to become a valuable independent infrastructure from a small beginning as a research project in my lab.

> The Research Centre was created specifically for two purposes: (a) to provide an institutional affiliation, a legal financial centre, and a formal administrative 'home' for OpenCitations, and (b) to permit academic activities affiliated with OpenCitations, such as being the academic home for graduate students of the University of Bologna working on projects involving open citations.  The Research Centre is formally a part of the University of Bologna in a way that OpenCitations is not.

> In the medium-term future, OpenCitations may 'spin out' to become a non-profit foundation /association/Stiftung under direct governance by the wider academic community and other stakeholders, that is administratively and financially independent from the University of Bologna.  In that case, OpenCitations will continue with its stated mission of providing open bibliographic metadata and citations, and the Research Centre will continue as an integral part of the University of Bologna in its academic roles with respect to OpenCitations, and will probably by then also have expanded its activities to include other types of metadata-oriented research work, but it will no longer be administratively and financially responsible for OpenCitations.

> For these reasons of distinctiveness, it would be sensible if OpenCitations and the Research Centre for Open Scholarly Metadata were issued separate RORs from the start, rather than trying to disentangle them at some point down the line.  That was the basis of my thinking when I wrote.

---
mariagould
09/07/2021, 15:44:39 | 09/07/2021, 15:44:39
comment_text: We believe this should be reviewed at a later point to determine if there is a use case for a separate ROR ID for this center. 

---
adambuttrick
05/23/2022, 16:57:32 | 05/23/2022, 16:58:51
comment_text: Affiliation usage in 2022 continues to be a leading affiliation for the University of Bologna:

https://arxiv.org/ftp/arxiv/papers/2205/2205.06764.pdf

Since this is essentially a request to create a new ROR ID contingent on a hypothetical restructuring of the organizations, I'd advise we decline this request. They can resubmit in the event any of what they described in the above actually occurs.



---

labels: hold for later
title: Restore ID for Natural History Museum of Denmark
body:
From requestor: Error: https://ror.org/040ck2b86 serves a blank page, but should show our institution according to e.g. GBIF (https://registry.gbif.org/institution/68fcaba0-61fe-4e78-a460-4f37654d025d/identifier)

MG notes (sent to requestor for clarification):
It looks as though the ROR ID https://ror.org/040ck2b86 previously referenced the Natural History Museum of Denmark. We have another record in ROR that also refers to a Natural History Museum of Denmark: https://ror.org/0166x0j30. 

Since ROR has previously been synced to GRID, I imagine that what happened is that GRID merged the two records. ROR does not currently support redirected IDs, but this is functionality that we will implement in future. 

I am not sure, however, if it was correct to merge the two IDs referenced above. As far as I can tell, there is a Natural History Museum of Denmark in Aarhus (https://www.naturhistoriskmuseum.dk/, Wikidata Q12328428), and a Natural History Museum of Denmark in Copenhagen (https://snm.ku.dk/, Wikidata Q978464). Are these the same institution, or are they distinct?
comments:
mariagould
12/08/2021, 00:04:20 | 12/08/2021, 00:04:20
comment_text: Response from organization rep:

`The Natural History Museum in Aarhus and the one in Copenhagen are distinct institutions. The latter is referred to as “Natural History Museum of Denmark” (institution code NHMD), in Danish: “Statens Naturhistoriske Museum” (literally NHM of the State, also reflected in our url: snm.ku.dk), the other simply as “Natural History Museum Aarhus” (institution code NHMA). So the ROR ID https://ror.org/0166x0j30 refers to an entirely different entity (NHMA) leaving us in want of an entry for our own museum (NHMD), previously at: https://ror.org/040ck2b86. The latter ROR ID is what is referred to in the GBIF registry at https://registry.gbif.org/institution/68fcaba0-61fe-4e78-a460-4f37654d025d/identifier`

---
mariagould
12/08/2021, 00:06:20 | 12/08/2021, 00:14:23
comment_text: We will need to restore the old ROR ID https://ror.org/040ck2b86 for Natural History Museum of Denmark. Putting this on hold until we have the functionality in place. We should make a new issue to update the name for https://ror.org/0166x0j30 (see #385)

---
FedorSteeman
03/30/2022, 11:04:11 | 03/30/2022, 11:04:11
comment_text: Thanks for looking into this. I will be following this thread. 

---

I believe merging https://ror.org/00njt2653 and https://ror.org/05mx1gf76 would resolve the issue."

labels: level 1; new record; jaguar; hold for later; relationship
title:
Add a new organization to ROR: 
 
MARUM - Center for Marine Environmental Sciences
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: MARUM - Center for Marine Environmental Sciences
Website: https://www.marum.de/index.html
Link to publications: https://www.marum.de/Forschung/Peer-reviewed-MARUM-publications.html
Organization type: Education (A university or similar institution involved in providing education and educating/employing researchers)
Wikipedia page: https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marum_(Universit%C3%A4t_Bremen)
Wikidata ID: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q1905964
ISNI ID: https://isni.org/isni/000000011013246X
GRID ID: grid.474422.3 (from the 2017-05-22 GRID Release)
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization: MARUM - Zentrum für Marine Umweltwissenschaften
Acronym/abbreviation: MARUM
Related organizations: University of Bremen https://ror.org/04ers2y35 (parent)
City: Bremen
Country: Germany
Year established: 
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for datasets
Other information about this request:
comments:
arthurpsmith
09/09/2021, 13:38:56 | 09/09/2021, 13:39:05
comment_text: I added Wikidata and ISNI id's. This USED to be in GRID (I also added the old GRID id above), and in fact it used to have a ROR id also - https://ror.org/02gn1ar53 (from an old ROR dump I believe) - but GRID merged it into the University of Bremen record, and the ROR link is now dead.

Will look into this a bit more to see if it really should have its own ROR. The independent website marum.de is a good sign.

---
arthurpsmith
09/09/2021, 13:45:24 | 09/09/2021, 13:45:24
comment_text: Ok, they have a lot of people publishing using it as an affiliation, but it always in the ones I found it is in the form "MARUM, ..., University of Bremen", so that indicates it isn't considered completely independent from the university as far as affiliation listings go.

However, MARUM is one of the hosts for PANGAEA, which is an important Earth & Environmental Science data repository, and they are a significant provider of datasets. This may be a somewhat borderline case, but I think given the scope of their activities and the independent website it should have (restore) a ROR id. Can we re-use the old one for this?

---
carlyrobinson
11/01/2021, 12:41:14 | 11/01/2021, 12:41:14
comment_text: Agee that this should be in ROR. Would be great to use the old ROR ID. 

---
adambuttrick
03/07/2022, 21:21:34 | 03/07/2022, 21:21:34
comment_text: Requires development work for us to reinstate the ID and guarantee the ID generation service won't produce it again.

Sieć Badawcza Łukasiewicz - Instytut Mikroelektroniki i Fotoniki (Łukasiewicz Research Network - Institute of Microelectronics and Photonics, Łukasiewicz - IMiF) (https://imif.lukasiewicz.gov.pl) was established on October 1, 2020 as a result of the merger of the Institute of Electron Technology and the Institute of Electronic Materials Technology.

comments:
adambuttrick
02/23/2022, 16:35:24 | 02/23/2022, 16:36:23
comment_text: Biotechnology company whose primary focus is a novel Alzheimer's therapeutic. Principals are all well-credentialed with solid publication history (https://phanesbiotech.com/publications/), but do not appear to use Phanes Biotech as their primary affiliation. That being said, is clearly involved with drug development and research and we have many similar companies in ROR (e.g. https://ror.org/02eb03q95 ; https://ror.org/043f79m81).

---
arthurpsmith
04/22/2022, 12:47:32 | 04/22/2022, 12:47:32
comment_text: Hmm, I think we should wait on this one. There's a very similarly named company that appears to be larger and more well-established, "Phanes Therapeutics" - https://www.phanesthera.com/ (from San Diego, established 2016) - for which we do not have a ROR ID, and it seems likely if we create one for this company without creating one for the other that could lead to some confusion. I can't find any relationship between the two, and this company is not listed for example in Crunchbase or mentioned in any news reports I could find.

The publications listed on their "publications" page are all from 2017 or earlier as far as I could see, which predates the company formation (so it wouldn't have been used as an affiliation). I recommend we put this on hold until we see they are actually publishing or funding research with this affiliation.

---
adambuttrick
05/03/2022, 15:52:13 | 05/03/2022, 15:52:13
comment_text: Moving to hold for later to see if further evidence of affiliation usage surfaces.

---

adambuttrick
06/17/2022, 15:27:40 | 06/17/2022, 15:27:40
comment_text: Cross-institutional project to develop a new generation sensor/monitoring networks for tracking the habitability of ecological systems in the context of climate change.

The project appears relatively new and in trial phases with a couple of facilities, so there is little in the way of research outputs or affiliation usage. That said, it has the backing of multiple CNRS institutions (e.g. https://www.insu.cnrs.fr/fr/cnrsinfo/terra-forma-un-nouveau-paradigme-pour-lobservation-des-territoires ; ), so I don't think there are any concerns about its viability. More about whether to create a ROR now or await the research outputs, funding acknowledgements, etc.

---
arthurpsmith
07/15/2022, 18:05:01 | 07/15/2022, 18:05:01
comment_text: Does the website work at all for you? I just get a blank page at terra-forma.cnrs.fr ??? Anyway, the various other pages that describe this routinely use the word "project", and our guidelines suggest ROR's should not be created for a "term-limited project". Also it's not clear to me that anybody would actually use this as an affiliation. And their suggested hierarchy would be disruptive I think - we don't want every widely supported project to appear in the hierarchy tree of organizations, this is not really a parent of the listed entities.

I recommend waiting at least 6 months to see actual research outputs and see if any researchers are actually stating TERRA FORMA as their affiliation, rather than the underlying organizations (also to see if the website is actually a stable reliable source of information). If this really is a term-limited project, perhaps we should direct them to request a RAiD identifier rather than ROR - https://www.raid.org.au

---
adambuttrick
07/15/2022, 18:12:33 | 07/15/2022, 18:12:57
comment_text: @arthurpsmith It worked for me at time of review, but it looks as like it might have gone down. I agree with your overall sentiment, however, so we can move this to hold for later.

---

labels: level 2; update record; jaguar; hold for later
title:
Deprecate an existing ROR record: 
 
SuperGen (United States)https://ror.org/049922318
body:
Summary of request: Deprecate an existing ROR record

Merge/split/deprecate records:
Organizations affected by this change:SuperGen (United States)
ROR ID(s) of organization(s) affected by this change: https://ror.org/049922318
How should the record(s) be changed? Suggest that https://ror.org/049922318 is deprecated. SuperGen was merged into Astex Pharmaceuticals, Inc. in 2011 (see https://astx.com/discover-astex/our-history/). URL is dead; ISNI 0000 0004 0411 1795 conflates the two companies that were merged and their successor. 

Perhaps also create two RORs for the successor's US (http://www.wikidata.org/entity/Q106995996) and UK (http://www.wikidata.org/entity/Q4810825) locations (as per https://astx.com/contact/). Both are wholly-owned subsidiaries of https://ror.org/013k5y296 since 2013.
comments:
adambuttrick
08/08/2022, 15:01:18 | 08/08/2022, 15:01:18
comment_text: Organization is no longer in existence.
